metadata.title: CVE-2014-0162 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Sheepdog backend in OpenStack Image Registry and Delivery Service(Glance) 2013.2 before 2013.2.4 and icehouse before icehouse-rc2 allowsremote authenticated users with permission to insert or modify an image toexecute arbitrary commands via a crafted location.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glance - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1
glance-api - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1
glance-common - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1
glance-registry - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1
python-glance - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glance package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1-0ubuntu1').
